title.rendered: New Name, Logo, and Identity for Ocay by Essen International

content.rendered:
Formed in 2013, Kontorsvaruhuset Gullbergs is the result of the merger of two of the leading office supply companies in Sweden with the former established in 1998 with a large presence in North Sweden and the latter in 1936 in South Sweden. Their combined 38 stores have now been renamed Ocay and launched with a new identity designed by Stockholm-based Essen International.

Starting Point
– Ocay is the machinery behind the scenes. Office supplies for all companies, every day. Without their products, companies stand still.
–Ocay is bold, happy and easy going. It’s a brand you want to be friends with.

Symbol / Logo
– The product is celebrated through the symbol: the exclamation mark.
– The symbol is a flexible tool that is used to communicate the different product categories in catalogs, online and in retail environments.

Typography
–The custom made version of the Railroad font creates impact in crowded spaces due to its condensed and bold style.

Color
– In a generic and red industry, Ocay is the green choice — in colour and in attitude.

Provided text

Both of the previous logos were fairly good and looked appropriate for an office supply store, perhaps a little more heavy-handed on the art store aesthetic with the swashy “G” of Gullbergs and colored pencil of Kontorsvaruhuset. But with the merger and new name (also created by Essen) both logos had to go and in their place is a super chunky wordmark — just like I like ’em — with plenty of bounce and personality. The four letters fit together nicely and the shifting baseline helps the “A” wedge in well and avoid the usual open space at the top. I sort of wish the bounciness was taken one step further so that it isn’t just down-up, down-up but a more varied rhythm. Nonetheless, the name is great, the exclamation point is great, and the color is great. I would love an office supply company identity like that in the sea of Office This and Office That in the U.S..

In application, the custom version of Railroad Gothic does most of the heavy lifting in large swathes of colored blocks, mainly green. Overall, there is a very well achieved balance of earthiness, corporate-ness, and artsiness in the logo and identity that should keep everyone who needs office supplies in Sweden well represented.
